author: Todd Shields
title: Former Lake Zurich fire chief pleads guilty to battery Lake Zurich Courier
text:
Prosecutors say Lake Zurich's former fire chief has pleaded guilty to domestic battery and gotten 12 months of court supervision.
Under the terms of the agreement, David Wheelock must not have contact with the victim, possess illegal drugs or consume alcohol during those 12 months, according to Cynthia Vargas, spokeswoman for the Lake County State's Attorney's Office.
Vargas also said that the Sept. 30 court supervision order was a "deferred conviction," so if the supervision's conditions were met, the case would be terminated. That means only an arrest, not a conviction, would appear on his record, Vargas said.
Wheelock, 55, retired May 8 after being charged with two counts of misdemeanor domestic battery for an incident stemming from a May 4 altercation with someone at his home in the 21000 block of West Highland Drive in an unincorporated area near Lake Zurich.
Wheelock's attorney, Christina Ivashchenko, said the reference to drugs and alcohol in her client's supervision conditions are part of a court's order in cases such as this, and not specific to Wheelock's situation.
"He still maintains the original charge was without due cause, but he accepted the reduction as a way of compromising," Ivashchenko said. "He hopes to put all this behind him."
A Pioneer Press report in May found that Wheelock was to receive $105,000 in accrued time off, as well as an annual pension of at least $90,000, as part of his retirement package.
Suburban Chicago arrest photos Open link At a Village Board meeting in 2014, Wheelock was honored for his 35 years of service to the Lake Zurich Fire Department.
The former chief was an active community member, and is the immediate past president of the Rotary Club of Lake Zurich .
Mount Prospect Fire Chief John Malcolm is due to take over as chief of the Lake Zurich Fire Department later this month.
